UML:TaggedValue.value:
Design and establish uStore. Inspired by Apple’s “App Store” concept, the uStore will provide a one-stop-shop for universAAL end-user services. The uStore will:
  • Contain applications for end-users; it is by downloading and deploying such applications to their own execution platforms that end-users participate in end-user services.
  • Adopt a mixed policy on pricing: many resources will be free, some will require purchase. o Allow users not only to obtain things from the uStore, but also to contribute new items to itg. new applications developed by companies or individuals; new adapters.
  • Designandimplementanapprovalprocessforensuringthatresourcesmadeavailableinthe uStore are consistent with universAAL architectural policies, and do not pose any kind of threat to end-users.

UML:Class.name: O6- Extend the range of actors involved in creating and operating AAL solutions

UML:TaggedValue.value:
Extend the range of actors involved in creating and operating AAL solutions. The project will promote a move away from today’s “monolithic” approach in which a complete solution is designed and delivered by a single, organisation. It will:
  • Exploit the potential of the SOA approach to allow user-level AAL services to be composed from lower-level elements, each of which can be provided by independent actors;
  • Develop an open, modular approach that non-experts can learn and apply for specific tasks with a minimum investment of time and effort;
  • MakeitfeasibleforSMEstobeabletomakemoneybydeveloping“niche”services;
  • Makeitfeasibleforprivateindividualswithlittleornoprogrammingexperience(e.g.family members) to adapt existing AAL services to their personal needs, or even to produce new applications / services.

UML:Class.name: O5-Design the platform to be open and allow interoperability with existing systems / other domains

UML:TaggedValue.value: Design the platform to be open, and allow interoperability with existing systems / other domains. This will involve developing tools which generate adapters i.e. software components which make it possible for a universAAL system to exchange data with and invoke / be invoked by other non- universAAL systems in use in the home, such as personal health systems and systems for energy efficiency.
O5-Design the platform to be open and allow interoperability with existing systems / other domains
O5-Design the platform to be open and allow interoperability with existing systems / other domains
Economically viable to conceive, design and deploy innovative AAL Services
Technical Feasible to conceive, design and deploy innovative AAL Services

UML:Class.name: O2-Design and establish the unviersAAL developer depot

UML:TaggedValue.value: Design and establish the universAAL developer depot. This will contain all resources needed by developers: all parts of the platform itself, tools, basic services for incorporation in new end-user services, adapter components for interoperability with non-universAAL systems, libraries of “drivers” supporting use of different sensors etc. available on the open market.
O2-Design and establish the unviersAAL developer depot
O2-Design and establish the unviersAAL developer depot
O2-Design and establish the unviersAAL developer depot

UML:Class.name: Economically viable to conceive, design and deploy innovative AAL Services

UML:TaggedValue.value:
The main objective of the project is to make it technically feasible and economically viable to conceive, design and deploy innovative new AAL services. To do this, we will:
  • Produce a platform providing the necessary technical support, and acting as an open, common basis for both developers and end-users;
  • Carry out support activities promoting widespread acceptance and adoption of the platform. These activities form an integral part of the project and will start at an early stage.

UML:Class.name: Technical Feasible to conceive, design and deploy innovative AAL Services

UML:TaggedValue.value:
The main objective of the project is to make it technically feasible and economically viable to conceive, design and deploy innovative new AAL services. To do this, we will:
  • Produce a platform providing the necessary technical support, and acting as an open, common basis for both developers and end-users;
  • Carry out support activities promoting widespread acceptance and adoption of the platform. These activities form an integral part of the project and will start at an early stage.

UML:Class.name: O4-Devise a technical strategy for achieving interoperability amongst universAAL platform elements

UML:TaggedValue.value:
Devise a technical strategy for achieving interoperability amongst universAAL platform elements in terms of:
  • Allow execution on a wide variety of different HW/operating system execution platforms, e.g. mobile phones, fixed PCs, laptops, STBs (set-top-boxes);
  • Allow plug-and-play use of sensors/actuators and other equipment available on the open market.
  • Alloweasycompositionofserviceelementsdevelopedusingtheplatform,toprovidehigher- level services;
O4-Devise a technical strategy for achieving interoperability amongst universAAL platform elements
O4-Devise a technical strategy for achieving interoperability amongst universAAL platform elements
O4-Devise a technical strategy for achieving interoperability amongst universAAL platform elements
O4-Devise a technical strategy for achieving interoperability amongst universAAL platform elements
O4-Devise a technical strategy for achieving interoperability amongst universAAL platform elements

UML:Class.name: O3-Consolidate existing work and integrate with new development

UML:TaggedValue.value:
Consolidate existing work and integrate with new development. UniversAAL will build on existing solutions from finished and running projects, including MPOWER (partners; SINTEF, Ericsson, AIT), PERSONA (partners; Fh-IGD, ITACA-UPV, CNR-ISTI, UPM, RSD), AMIGO (partners; Philips, DKE), SOPRANO (partners; FZI, ProSyst), OASIS (CERTH, UPM, ITACA- UPV) and GENESYS (TUW, Fh-IGD). UniversAAL will directly use results from these projects:
  • Analyseindetailthescope/roleoftheseprojects,andtheresultsfinallyproduced.
  • Identifyareasofoverlap,strengths&weakness,andthingsnotcovered.
  • Produce a strategy for full technical integration of a subset of results from these earlier projects, to combine these with the new development work carried out in universAAL.
  • Makeanearlyrelease(withinthefirstyear)ofaninitialintegrationexercise,andusethisto gather experience and feedback.
  • Define a component integration strategy with criteria for selection and acceptance of components to integrate, in order to establish a reliable reference implementation of the platform
  • Integrateasetofgenericplatformservicesincludingaccessibleandadaptableuserinterfaces (personalization), context awareness, and privacy and security
  • o Give priority to the cost effectiveness of the platform in use, by careful selection of services and tools, packaging for simple deployment, and support for cost effective hardware.

UML:Class.name: O8-Demonstrate the practical usefulness of the approach

UML:TaggedValue.value: Demonstrate the practical usefulness of the approach using a set of proof-of-concept scenarios which – taken together - evaluate all aspects of the platform.

UML:Class.name: O7-Actively promote widespread adoption of the universAAL approach and platform

UML:TaggedValue.value:
Actively promote widespread adoption of the universAAL approach and platform. The project will:
  • Establish and support a sustainable universAAL community for AAL developers, i.e. people who will use the platform to develop new AAL services.objectives: Promoting widespread adoption
  • Establish and support a universAAL community for open source developers, i.e. people who will – after the project itself has finished – ensure that the platform itself evolves and lives on. Work on establishing communities will start within the first year of the project.
  • Produce a set of technical training materials for two target groups: (1) Researchers and the open source community; and (2) “decision makers” involved in software/service development. All of these will be used actively as part of an overall strategy to encourage uptake of results, while at the same time gathering feedback for refinement of technical concepts.
  • AAL services do not operate in a void, and UniversAAL will apply standards, evaluate their use, and contribute to standardisation work in related fields, including eHealth and energy efficiency. This is to ensure that the UniversAAL platform is not isolated from but rather complementary to work in these adjacent fields of operation. As an example, if you install a temperature monitor to regulate the temperature in a senior’s home, it should be possible to use the same sensor for energy efficiency applications. Setting standards on interfaces and performance requirements for components and products, as well as on levels of service quality of suppliers, shall support dissemination, application and quality of the developed system. Additionally, these standards may serve as references for European Commission Directives.
O7-Actively promote widespread adoption of the universAAL approach and platform

EAScenario.name: UAAL Main Objective
EAScenario.description: The main objective of the project is to make it technically feasible and economically viable to conceive, design and deploy innovative new AAL services. To do this, we will: · Produce a platform providing the necessary technical support, and acting as an open, common basis for both developers and end-users; · Carry out support activities promoting widespread acceptance and adoption of the platform. These activities form an integral part of the project and will start at an early stage.
